title: E-liter 4K
content:
The E-liter 4K is a main weapon in Splatoon 2 and Splatoon 3, a successor to Splatoon's E-liter 3K. It is a charger-type weapon that sacrifices mobility, ink consumption and charge time for extreme range that is only outclassed by its scoped variant.

Like most chargers, this weapon can store a fully charged shot in swim form for a short amount of time, and a fully charged shot will pierce through opponents.

In general, the E-liter 4K is based on a plastic gas pump handle with a metallic ink tank on the back and an elongated metallic spout with a plastic attachment and a black sight which acts as the barrel.

In Splatoon 2, the plastic parts are yellow and the ink tank changes color to match the user's ink.

In Splatoon 3, the plastic parts are blue, the handle also has a seven-segment LCD display, and the tube connecting the handle to the ink tank and a spring on the barrel change color to match the user's ink.

The E-liter 4K comes with Ink Mines and Ink Storm. It can store a charge for one second.

It appears in four Octo Expansion stations:

- D02 One-Shot Station

- D05 All That 8-Ball Station

- G03 House Party Station

- I06 All Eyez Station

- ▲ Has the ability to store a full charge for one second in squid/octopus form.

- ▲ Range when not fully charged is no longer reduced by about 20%.

- ▲ Fully charged ink consumption: 30% → 25%.

- ▼ Movement speed while not charging or firing is reduced by 8.3%: 0.96 units/frame → 0.88 units/frame.

- ▼ Range when fully charged decreased by about 15%: 340 units → 290.5 units.

- ▼ Maximum damage without full charge: 100.0 → 80.0.

- ▼ Charge time: 94 frames → 96 frames.

- ▼ There is a glow while charging and gets brighter the more the weapon is charged, increasing visibility for opponents.

- ▲ Reduced amount of time required to fully charge a shot by 4/60 of a second: 96 frames → 92 frames.

- ▲ Points to fill special gauge: 190 → 170.

- ▲ Increased radius of ink coverage when shots hit a wall by roughly 33%.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opposing Ballers when flinging ink by roughly 30%: 1x → 1.3x.

- ▲ When storing a charged shot with a Charger, swimming into enemy ink and being returned to kid form now allows you to maintain the charge you had stored.

- — Fixed an issue preventing players using a Charger from shooting when pressing  again after releasing the button once a stored charged shot had expired.

- ▲ In Rainmaker mode, equipping weapons such as the E-liter 4K and Dynamo Roller will no longer lower movement and swim speed while holding the Rainmaker.

- ▲ Increased the amount of ink splattered by each shot when it hits the ground.

- ▲ Increased speed of fully-charged shots by roughly 50% without changing shot distance: 64 units/frame → 96 units/frame.

- ▲ Area at player's feet will now always be inked when firing.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to the barrier around the Rainmaker by a fully-charged shot by roughly 15%: 2x → 2.3x.

- ▲ Increased the effect of the Main Power Up gear ability.

- ▲ The increase to shot range with the maximum number of Main Power Up gear abilities equipped has been raised from roughly 3% to roughly 5%.

- ▲ In addition to the existing effect, Main Power Up will now also improve ink coverage.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Splat Brellas by 17%: 3x → 3.5x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Tenta and Undercover Brellas by 20%: 2x → 2.4x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to Bubble Blower by 23%: 1.3x → 1.6x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Booyah Bomb armor by 4%: 1.3x → 1.35x.

- ▲ Increased damage dealt to opponent Splash Walls by 10%: 2x → 2.2x.

- ▲ Reduced the time from releasing a charge shot to being ready to shoot by roughly 2/60 of a second.

With its pressurized polymer construction, the E-liter 4K has a remarkably long range, even for a charger! This model offers a more compact design than the original, which has cut into its range slightly, but it still has plenty of reach! Use the accompanying Ink Mines to cover your tracks, and then bring the Ink Storm special to expose anyone who dares hide from you!

With its pressurized polymer construction, the E-liter 4K has a remarkably long range, even for a charger! To get the most out of it, you can set Ink Mines for opponents who get too close, then use the Wave Breaker special to reveal those who are slinking around in the ink. Still, this set is all about long-range accuracy, and in the right hands, it will definitely hit the target. I hope it goes to a good home!

- The E-liter 4K is designed to look like a gas pump.

- The E-liter 4K and its variants are created by Custom.

- The E-liter 4K was one of the weapons that was available to use in the Splatoon 3 Splatfest World Premiere.

- For Judd's trial on the Ink Mine, the player is given the E-Liter 4K.

- Across all three games, the E-Liter 4K (3K in Splatoon) has the same special as the Custom Splattershot Jr.

E-liter is a pun on elite and liter (the metric unit of volume by which gasoline is sold in many countries). The 4K in the name refers to the number of fully charged shots the weapon can fire before running out of ink, which is four.
